title: For TY 2025-26 and after
description: Retrieve a Foreign property Business Source Adjustable Summary Response.

metadata.description: Object containing the identifying data for the business and associated information for the BSAS with this ID.

calculationId.description: The unique identifier of the summary calculation.

requestedDateTime.description: The date and time the summary calculation was originally requested, prior to any adjustments.

adjustedDateTime.description: The date and time this calculation was adjusted.

nino.description: National Insurance number, in the format AA999999A.

taxYear.description: The tax year the data applies to, for example, 2021-22. The start year and end year must not span two tax years. No gaps are allowed, for example, 2020-22 is not valid.

summaryStatus.description: The status of the this calculated summary.

inputs.description: Object containing the inputs that were used in this calculation.

businessId.description: An identifier for the business, unique to the customer.

accountingPeriodStartDate.description: The date the accounting period started. Note: Accounting period start and end dates should not be displayed to users of your software.

accountingPeriodEndDate.description: The date the accounting period ended. Note: Accounting period start and end dates should not be displayed to users of your software.

source.description: Specifies the source of the income data used in this calculation.

submissionPeriod.description: Object containing the submission period for the income source.

submissionId.description: A reference to the unique identifier of the period.

startDate.description: The date the submission period started.

endDate.description: The date the submission period ended.

receivedDateTime.description: The date and time data received.

adjustableSummaryCalculation.description: Object containing the details about foreign property summary calculation.

totalIncome.description: The total income for the income source. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

income.description: Object containing the fields that can be adjusted for foreign property income sources.

totalRentsReceived.description: The total amount of property rental income. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

premiumsOfLeaseGrant.description: Premiums received for the grant of a lease and other lump sums to possess a property. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

otherPropertyIncome.description: Other income from property, such as rent charges and ground rents, income from letting others tip waste on your land, and income for the use of a caravan or houseboat at a fixed location. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

totalExpenses.description: The total expenses for the income source. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

expenses.description: Object containing the expenses for foreign property income sources.

consolidatedExpenses.description: Sum of all expenses for the specified period. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

premisesRunningCosts.description: Rent, rates, insurance, ground rents etc. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

repairsAndMaintenance.description: Property repairs and maintenance. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

financialCosts.description: Loan interest and other financial costs. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

professionalFees.description: Legal, management and other professional fees. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

costOfServices.description: Cost of services provided, including wages. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

residentialFinancialCost.description: Captures residential financial cost that can be deductible from rental income (tax relief). The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

broughtFwdResidentialFinancialCost.description: Amount of relief brought forward for restricted residential financial costs. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

other.description: Other allowable property expenses. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

travelCosts.description: Car, van and travel costs incurred in running a property business. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

netProfit.description: The net profit of income source. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

netLoss.description: The net loss of income source. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

totalAdditions.description: The total additions to net profit (or deduction to net loss). The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

additions.description: Object containing the breakdown of the adjustable additions for the accounting period.

privateUseAdjustment.description: Private use adjustment on an asset by a sole trader or partner in a partnership, the asset is put in to a single-asset pool and allowances are restricted on the business to private-use ratio. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

balancingCharge.description: Balancing charge on sale or cessation of business use (where you have disposed of assets for more than their tax value). The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

totalDeductions.description: The total deductions to net loss (or addition to net profit). The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

deductions.description: Object containing the deduction for foreign property income sources.

annualInvestmentAllowance.description: Annual investment allowance on items that qualify up to the AIA amount. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

costOfReplacingDomesticItems.description: Cost of Replacing Domestic Items - formerly Wear and Tear allowance. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

zeroEmissionGoods.description: Zero emission goods vehicle allowance for goods vehicles purchased for business use. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

propertyAllowance.description: The amount of property allowance income received. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

otherCapitalAllowance.description: Other capital allowances. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

structuredBuildingAllowance.description: The amount of enhanced structured building allowance.  The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

zeroEmissionsCarAllowance.description: The amount of zero emissions car allowance. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

taxableProfit.description: Amount of taxable net profit. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999 no decimal places.

adjustedIncomeTaxLoss.description: Amount of taxable net loss. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999 no decimal places.

countryLevelDetail.description: Array containing a breakdown of the foreign property by country.

countryCode.description: A three-letter code that represents a country name. This must be an ISO 3166-1 Alpha-3 value.

totalIncome.description: The total income for the income source. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

income.description: Object containing the fields that can be adjusted for foreign property income sources.

electricChargePointAllowance.description: The expenditure incurred on electric charge-point equipment. The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places.

countryLevelDetail.description: Array containing a breakdown of the foreign property by country.

countryCode.description: A three-letter code that represents a country name. This must be an ISO 3166-1 Alpha-3 value.

income.description: Object containing the adjustments to income.

totalRentsReceived.description: The total amount of property rental Income. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places (excluding 0 or 0.00).

premiumsOfLeaseGrant.description: Premiums received for the grant of a lease and other lump sums to possess a property. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places (excluding 0 or 0.00).

otherPropertyIncome.description: Other income from property, such as rent charges and ground rents, income from letting others tip waste on your land, and income for the use of a caravan or houseboat at a fixed location. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places (excluding 0 or 0.00).

expenses.description: Object containing the adjustments to expenses.

premisesRunningCosts.description: Rent, rates, insurance, ground rents etc. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places (excluding 0 or 0.00).

repairsAndMaintenance.description: Property repairs and maintenance. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places (excluding 0 or 0.00).

financialCosts.description: Loan interest and other financial costs. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places (excluding 0 or 0.00).

costOfServices.description: Cost of services provided, including wages. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places (excluding 0 or 0.00).

residentialFinancialCost.description: Captures residential financial cost that can be deductible from rental income (tax relief). The value must be between 0 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places (excluding 0 or 0.00).

travelCosts.description: Car, van and travel costs incurred in running a property business. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places (excluding 0 or 0.00).

other.description: Other allowable property expenses. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places (excluding 0 or 0.00).

consolidatedExpenses.description: Sum of all expenses for the specified period. The value must be between -99999999999.99 and 99999999999.99 up to 2 decimal places (excluding 0 or 0.00).

zeroAdjustments.description: Indicates zero adjustments for all income and expenses. The value must be true if this is the case.

adjustedSummaryCalculation.description: Object containing the latest foreign property summary calculation.
